item.title: Mayor Adams hits ground running in first day and promises to 'get stuff done'...
item.description:
www.nydailynews.com
Eric Adams, New York City’s newly-minted 110th mayor, kicked off his morning waiting for the J train with a call to 911 after witnessing a fight. He then gave his first speech to New Yorkers — remotely from City Hall’s Blue Room. After that, he headed to New York-Prebyterian/Weill Cornell to check on a cop who’d been shot earlier in the morning.

item.title: Vandals set fire to Key West's most famous landmark, causing 'extensive damage'...
item.description:
news.yahoo.com
The hunt is on for two men who defaced one of Key West’s most famous and most photographed landmarks on New Year’s Day: the giant and colorful Southernmost Point buoy. The vandals caused “extensive damage” to the buoy between 3 and 3:30 a.m. Saturday, according to Key West police. And, the incident was caught on video. The most noticeable damage is on the front of the buoy, with charring over ...

item.title: Brady faces Wilson in largest age gap between QBs...
item.description:
apnews.com
EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. (AP) — Tom Brady was beginning his senior season at Michigan when he celebrated his 22nd birthday, a fresh-faced quarterback who was eight months away from being an unheralded sixth-round draft pick.

item.title: Crews use ropes, helicopters to rescue 20 on stuck tram car...
item.description:
apnews.com
ALBUQUERQUE, N.M. (AP) — Search and rescue crews used ropes and helicopters Saturday to rescue 20 people who were stranded overnight in a tram car after an iced-over cable caused the car to get stuck high up in the Sandia Mountains overlooking Albuquerque, authorities said.

item.title: Judge: Prince Andrew can't halt suit with domicile claim...
item.description:

NEW YORK (AP) — Prince Andrew’s effort to immediately block the progression of a lawsuit by a woman who says he sexually assaulted her when she was 17 — on the grounds that she no longer lives in the U.S.

item.title: STUDY: Worrying About COVID Leads To Mental Decline...
item.description:

item.title: NYC will consider race when distributing life-saving virus treatments...
item.description:
nypost.com
New York City will take a patient’s race into account when distributing potentially life-saving COVID treatments, the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene revealed.

item.title: Thousands more flights canceled...
item.description:
apnews.com
For air travelers, the new year picked up where the old one left off – with lots of frustration. By late morning Saturday on the East Coast, more than 2,400 U.S. flights and nearly 4,200 worldwide had been canceled, according to tracking service FlightAware.

item.description:

DALLAS -- For air travelers, the new year picked up where the old one left off – with lots of frustration. By midmorning Saturday on the East Coast, more than 2,300 U.S. flights had been canceled, according to tracking service FlightAware.

item.description:

The US is ringing in the new year amid a Covid-19 surge that experts warn is exploding at unprecedented speed and could alter daily life for many Americans during the first month of 2022.

item.title: In nation at war with self, town tries cup of civility...
item.description:
apnews.com
LOVETTSVILLE, Va. (AP) — When Maureen Donnelly Morris came from nearby Leesburg to open her café in Lovettsville, she got a warm welcome. Neighbors rallied to her aid. Divisions ripping at their town and their country were set aside.

item.title: Critics in Egypt say CITROEN ad promotes sexual harassment...
item.description:
apnews.com
CAIRO (AP) — An advertisement by a French automaker has stirred up controversy in Egypt after activists said it promotes sexual harassment in a country where the practice is rampant. The ad by the Egyptian branch of Citroën, released last month, shows popular Egyptian singer and actor Amr Diab driving the latest version of the company’s C4, before coming to an abrupt stop in front of a woman crossing the street.

item.title: BETTY WHITE DEAD AT 99
item.description:
www.tmz.com
Betty White, beloved ‘Golden Girls’ actress, comedian and American icon is dead at the age of 99. Betty passed away just weeks before what would have been her 100th birthday.

item.title: 8-DECADE CAREER

item.title: AMERICA'S SWEETHEART
item.description:
www.click2houston.com
Betty White, whose saucy, up-for-anything charm made her a television mainstay for more than 60 years, whether as a man-crazy TV hostess on “The Mary Tyler Moore Show” or the loopy housemate on “The Golden Girls,” has died. She was 99.

item.title: Colorado fire victims begin new year surveying destruction...
item.description:
apnews.com
SUPERIOR, Colo. (AP) — Hundreds of Colorado residents who had expected to ring in 2022 in their homes are instead starting off the new year trying to salvage what remains of them after a wind-whipped wildfire tore through the Denver suburbs.

item.title: Colleges returning to online classes...
item.description:
apnews.com
With COVID-19 cases surging just as students are about to return from winter break, dozens of U.S. colleges are moving classes online again for at least the first week or so of the semester — and some warn it could stretch longer if the wave of infection doesn’t subside soon.
